alert.note: Alert for San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 12:53PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... San Juan River At Farmington affecting San Juan County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...San Juan River at Farmington. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 6.5 feet late Wednesday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon around 100 PM MDT.
